text: Taraka, usually derived from Sanskrit tāraka (, "crossing; ferryman; star; eye"), may refer to: == Hinduism == * Taraka mantra, various mantras spoken by Hindus at their deaths * Tārakāsura, an asura defeated by Skanda * Taraka (goddess), wife of god Brihaspati * Tataka, a yaksha-turned-demoness == People == * N. T. Rama Rao (Taraka Rama Rao Nandamuri, 1923-1996), Indian Telugu film veteran actor and politician * N. T. Rama Rao Jr. (Taraka Rama Rao Nandamuri, Jr.), Indian Telugu film actor; grandson of N. T. Rama Rao * Taraka Ratna (Taraka Ratna Nandamuri), Indian Telugu film actor; grandson of N. T. Rama Rao == Other uses == * Taraka, Lanao del Sur, a municipality in the Philippines. * Taraka, Papua New Guinea, a suburb of Lae in the Morobe Province, Papua New Guinea * Taraka (butterfly), a genus of butterflies ==See also== * Tarak (disambiguation), the Hindi form of the Sanskrit name Taraka
title: Taraka
